@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Make it look exactly like this

public boolean isUntradable(int item) { for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) { if(untradable[i] == item) { return true; } return false; } }

item.title: I got an error making admin glow! ):
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Add another } above :

 public boolean fired = false;

So it is like this :

public boolean isUntradable(int item) {
  for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) {
   if(untradable[i] == item) {
    return true;
  }
 return false;
  }
  }
public boolean fired = false;
public boolean firingspell = false;

Try that, if that doesn’t work then just delete the } you just added and leave the space there.

Read full topic

item.title: I got an error making admin glow! ):
item.dc:creator: @i4mg0d i4mg0d
item.description:
@i4mg0d wrote:

client.java:3501: illegal start of expression public boolean fired = false; ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Thats the error. In PIMPSCAPE.

This is what i have :

public boolean isUntradable(int item) { for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) { if(untradable[i] == item) { return true; } return false; } public boolean fired = false; public boolean firingspell = false;
